entry.title: The Road Traffic (Permitted Parking Area and Special Parking Area) (Borough of Blackpool) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order applies to the whole of the Borough of Blackpool except the A5230 from the Ashworth Road Roundabout (including the circulatory carriageway at that roundabout) to the eastern boundary of the borough, the eastbound slip road from the A5230 to the roundabout junction of the A5230 and the A583 (but not any part of the circulatory carriageway at that roundabout), and the whole of the M55 within the borough.

entry.title: The Police Appeals Tribunals (Amendment) Rules 2003
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Police Appeals Tribunals Rules 1999 in consequence of the National Crime Squad being able to directly recruit officers following the bringing into force, to the extent they were not already in force, of sections 87 and 91 of the Police Reform Act 2002 (c. 32).

entry.title: The National Crime Squad (Senior Police Members) (Appeals) (Revocation) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order revokes, with savings, the National Crime Squad (Senior Police Members) (Appeals) Order 1998.

entry.title: The Police (Complaints) (General) (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Police (General) (Complaints) Regulations 1985 in consequence of the National Crime Squad being able to directly recruit officers below the rank of assistant chief constable. The provisions applicable to police officers in forces maintained under section 2 of the Police Act 1996 and the metropolitan police force and the City of London police are applied to members of the National Crime Squad.

entry.title: The Police (Promotion) (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Police (Promotion) Regulations 1996 to extend them to police members of the National Crime Squad appointed under section 55(1)(b) of the Police Act 1997. They also update a number of references to reflect the fact that the Police Regulations 1995 have been revoked and replaced by the Police Regulations 2003 and the Police Act 1964 has been re-enacted by the Police Act 1996.

entry.title: The Police (Efficiency) (Amendment No. 2) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Police (Efficiency) Regulations 1999 (“the 1999 Regulations”) in consequence of the National Crime Squad being able to directly recruit officers below the rank of assistant chief constable. The provisions applicable to police officers of the rank of chief superintendent or below in forces maintained under section 2 of the Police Act 1996 and the metropolitan police force and City of London police are applied to members of the National Crime Squad holding those ranks.

entry.title: The Police Reform Act 2002 (Commencement No. 5) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 15th November 2003 the provisions set out in article 2.

entry.title: The Immigration (Passenger Transit Visa) (Amendment No. 2) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order is made under section 41 of the Immigration and Asylum Act 1999 and amends the Immigration (Passenger Transit Visa) Order 2003 (“the 2003 Order”). The 2003 Order requires, subject to certain exemptions, citizens and nationals of countries and territories specified within it, along with holders of specified travel documents, to obtain a transit visa when passing through the United Kingdom on their way to another country or territory.

entry.title: The Police (Conduct) (Senior Officers) (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Police (Conduct) (Senior Officers) Regulations 1999 in consequence of the National Crime Squad being able to directly recruit officers of all ranks. They extend the disciplinary procedures applicable to senior officers in police forces maintained under section 2 of the Police Act 1996 and the metropolitan police force and the City of London police to senior officers in the National Crime Squad.

entry.title: The National Crime Squad (Dispensation from Requirement to Investigate Complaints) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations specify the circumstances in which the Police Complaints Authority may grant a dispensation from the requirement to investigate complaints concerning the conduct of members of the National Crime Squad. The Regulations are modelled on the Regulations applicable to other police officers (the Police (Dispensation from Requirement to Investigate Complaints) Regulations 1985).

entry.title: The Police (Conduct) (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Police (Conduct) Regulations 1999 in consequence of the National Crime Squad being able to directly recruit officers below the rank of assistant chief constable. The provisions applicable to police officers of the rank of chief superintendent or below in forces maintained under section 2 of the Police Act 1996 and the metropolitan police force and City of London police are applied to members of the National Crime Squad holding those ranks.

entry.title: The Police (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Police Regulations 2003 in consequence of the bringing into force of provisions in the Police Reform Act 2002 (c. 30) which enable the National Crime Squad to recruit officers below the rank of Assistant Chief Constable for permanent positions.

title.div: The Food (Star Anise from Third Countries) (Emergency Control) (Wales) (Revocation) Order 2003 / Gorchymyn Bwyd (Coed Anis o Drydydd Gwledydd) (Rheolaeth Frys) (Cymru) (Dirymu) 2003

div.p: This Order revokes the Food (Star Anise from Third Countries) (Emergency Control) (Wales) Order 2002 (S.I. 2002/402)(W.50)(“the 2002 Order”), which prohibited the import of Star Anise and Japanese Star Anise into Wales where it was consigned from a country outside the European Community unless certain conditions were met. The 2002 Order implemented Commission Decision 2002/75/EC laying down special conditions on the import from third countries of Star Anise (OJ No. L33, 2.2.2002, p.31). That Decision was repealed by Commission Decision 2003/602/EC (OJ No. L204, 13.8.2003, p.60).

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn dirymu Gorchymyn Bwyd (Coed Anis o Drydydd Gwledydd) (Rheolaeth Frys) (Cymru) 2002 (O.S. 2002/402) (Cy. 50) (“Gorchymyn 2002”), a oedd yn gwahardd mewnforio Coed Anis a Choed Anis Siapaneaidd i Gymru os o wlad y tu allan i'r Gymuned Ewropeaidd yr oeddent yn cael eu hanfon onid oedd amodau arbennig yn cael eu bodloni. Rhoddodd Gorchymyn 2002 ar waith Benderfyniad y Comisiwn 2002/75/EC sy'n pennu amodau arbennig ar fewnforio Coed Anis o drydydd gwledydd (OJ Rhif L33, 2.2.2002, t.31). Diddymwyd y Penderfyniad hwnnw gan Benderfyniad y Comisiwn 2003/602/EC (OJ Rhif L204, 13.8.2003, t.60).

title.div: The Health (Wales) Act 2003 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2003 / Gorchymyn Deddf Iechyd (Cymru) 2003 (Cychwyn Rhif 1) 2003

div.p: This is the first Commencement Order under the Health (Wales) Act 2003 (“the Act”).
Dyma'r Gorchymyn Cychwyn cyntaf o dan Ddeddf Iechyd (Cymru) 2003 (“y Ddeddf”).

entry.title: The Fishing Vessels (Decommissioning) Scheme 2003
entry.summary: This Scheme provides for the making of grants by the Secretary of State for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (“the Secretary of State”), in respect of the decommissioning of fishing vessels. The Scheme applies in relation to England only.

entry.title: The Newport (South Wales) Harbour Revision (Constitution) Order 2003
entry.summary: This order reconstitutes Newport South Wales Harbour Commissioners as from 1st November 2003. It provides for the Commissioners to consist of a body of eight Commissioners with experience in relevant matters. Seven Commissioners have been appointed by an appointments procedure. The remaining Commissioner will be an officer employed by the Commissioners.

entry.title: The Railways and Transport Safety Act 2003 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 31st October 2003 sections 111 and 115 of the Railways and Transport Safety Act 2003

entry.title: The Mental Health (Care and Treatment) (Scotland) Act 2003 (Consequential Modification) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order makes a consequential modification to section 64(2) of the Mental Health (Scotland) Act 1984 which is required following the amendment made to that subsection by paragraph 3(b) of schedule 6 to the Mental Health (Care and Treatment) (Scotland) Act 2003.

entry.title: The Education (Funding for Teacher Training) Designation (No.2) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order is made under section 4(2) of the Education Act 1994. It designates Undergraduate Ambassadors Limited, a company limited by guarantee and having the registration number 4861135, Calderdale Metropolitan Borough Council and Southend Education Action Forum as institutions eligible for funding under Part I of the Education Act 1994.

entry.title: The Bournemouth Primary Care Trust (Change of Name) Amendment Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order amends the Bournemouth Primary Care Trust (Establishment) Order 2000, which established the Bournemouth Primary Care Trust.
